name: Alice Springs YHA

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights and overall it's a good place to stay. The kitchen is large, clean and well stocked; there is a large common area with TV; there's a nice outdoor area that shows movies on a big screen. The hostel is centrally located, close to downtown, so you can walk anywhere you need to go I had a problem with rudeness from one of the receptionists as well, but I will say if you have a problem speak with the manager/owner- he was great and resolved the problem for me. Alice is worth a short visit- it's a historic town and you're right in the midle of Australia!
reviews.title: Pretty good hostel

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at Alice Springs Pioneer YHA and at first it was awesome! Good location, spacious and clean facilities and generally friendly staff. Until there was a problem.
reviews.title: The unnecessary rudeness of two of the female receptionists drove us to another hostel.

reviews.text: On our last night Amy, one of female receptionists, allocated us to a dorm bed that seemed to be empty but was in fact occupied. During the night we were woken up be an angry, drunk man that screamed that we had taken his bed and drove us away. Really unpleasant.
reviews.title: It's ok, but not great.

reviews.text: The next day both receptionists, Amy and Julia, were really rude and made us feel like we had somehow done something wrong up to a point were we decided to move to another hostel.
reviews.title: BED BUGS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole thing was completely unnecessary and could have easily been avoided if the receptionists had been polite and listened to us.
reviews.title: Good for a brief stop in Alice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pleased with how clean and tidy and organised everything was (not being a big fan of slumming it!). The kitchen was well equipped and clean. The pool is a bonus. We had a comfortable night and it was convenient for the town.
reviews.title: A reasonable stop for one night

reviews.text: This place is very well located in central Alice Springs, near to the "sails". The site used to be a drive-in cinema, and the history is kept alive with nightly outdoor film screenings. The staff were very helpful, organising groups of travellers for airport transfers (More people in a taxi = money saved) and storing bags for those going off on an Uluru tour (i.e. almost everyone). The pool is tiny, but very welcome to cool off. And you need to cool off a lot out here!
reviews.title: Well-located hostel

reviews.text: 3 nights in a 4 share room was great value, compared to motel prices. Had read quite a few comments on the YHA site that the kitchen was dirty - well the problem is dirty guests, not lack of effort by staff. Kitchen starts out clean each day, but soon lazy and thoughtless guests leave dishes around or splash stuff and then don't see their mess or don't care.
reviews.title: well-located and value hostel

reviews.text: The nature of departures is that people get up for 6am tour departures, so expect noise in your room or on the walkway outside. Showing movies nightly at 7.30 is a nice touch. Top location, easy access to supermarkets and other facilities.
reviews.title: O.K.

reviews.text: Be aware that list for shuttle to airport isn't consistently on the desk, and they don't readily tell you that pick up is NOT at the hostel but around the corner at the Aurora Hotel. Shuttle price one-way $18.50 v $32 for taxi, so if you can team up its a lot simpler to get a taxi instead of being carted around town doing pickups.
reviews.title: Great little hostel in the Outback!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's difficult to find anywhere to eat in Alice but Bo's Sallon & Dining Room otherwise know as BoJangles about 300m from the hostel is fun, cheap and hearty try try the mixed grill it's exotic.
reviews.title: Quirky in Good Location

reviews.text: We went for a double room share bathroom and there are some self contained ones on site an liked it, you can walk to all the attractions in Alice although it has to be said that they are very few and far between. We're both in our late 50s, but felt at home, friendly staff and cosmopolitan transient clientel just don't trust them or leave beer overnight in the fridge!
reviews.title: Average Hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had to stay in 2 different rooms: 4-beds and 16-beds. Also - the 16-mixed-beds are packed. Its ok for a night or 2, but its really just to go there to sleep. The 4-beds are much nicer, bigger, better beds.
reviews.title: Quiet, well-equipped hostel in central Alice Springs

reviews.text: There is a community kitchen - only if you hv a strong stomach. Also internet terminals, reasonable rates. Yes - they do have a SMALL pool! Not for swimming (its not so big), more for hanging your toe in.
reviews.title: OK YHA, but could do with freshening up

description: A unique and friendly hostel located in an historic former outdoor movie theatre. Right in the centre of town, close to transport, shops and sights. Multi share, twin/double and family rooms available. Kitchen, laundry, pool and fast internet.
